activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence L Shipp

defendant.name: Shipp, Terrence L

records.addlTxt:
From $250.00 cash bond to $1000.00 signature bond.  
Court Orders that an amended bond does not need to be signed by Defendant.

10:44 AM Defendant Terrence L Shipp appeared by video, in custody in Eau Claire County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Reporter appears by Zoom Video/Audio. 
COVERS 22CF215 & 22CM182.
Court relates counsel has not been found yet.  Defendant relates he is on a probation hold.  State relates.  BOTH Files set before Judge Boyle with other files on 11/22/22 @ 10:00 a.m. and may appear by Zoom. 

Court orders bond in 22CF215 modified from $250.00 cash bond to $1000.00 signature bond with same conditions. Defendant does not need to sign a new bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:00 AM Defendant Terrence L Shipp appeared by video, in custody at Eau Claire County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. This covers cases 22CF215 & 22CM182.  

Court relates counsel has not yet been appointed. DE qualifies for PD.  AIA set in both cases for 10/26/2022 at 10:00 AM.  DE may appear by Zoom Video to next appearance. Judge Bitney's Zoom information should be sent with notice of hearing.  Notice to be sent to Eau Claire County Jail. Bonds continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter from the Defendant regarding sharing information.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:25 PM Defendant Terrence L Shipp appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre appeared by video for Terrence L Shipp, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is eligible for PD but no one has been appointed yet. 
State relates to bond.
Court orders $250.00 cash bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
